summary:
UNESCO, short for the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, is a global agency with a big mission. It aims to bring countries together to create peace and progress. Founded after World War II, it works in education, science, art, and culture. UNESCO has almost 200 member countries and many partners.

Its work includes teaching literacy, supporting media freedom, and protecting important cultural sites. It also helps countries share ideas and knowledge. UNESCO is led by a Director-General, chosen every four years, and its decisions are made by member countries during their meetings.
title: UNESCO
